text: Atlantis, what's the problem?
What the hell was that?
The press is going to want answers. What are we going to say?
A big asteroid. E.T.A., eighteen days. A lot bigger than the five mile one that obliterated the dinosaurs.
Three things the Russians make well, guys - vodka, gymnasts and rockets. Don't count 'em out.

United States astronauts train for eighteen months. You have nine days. Officers Sharp, Truman, Watts and Weston are your military instructors and the only pilots to have flown the spacecraft. Each is a combat decorated officer and among the finest men and women we have in the service. Pay attention to them.

You will vomit.  Your eyes will be sucked into the back of your heads. You'll be so tired you can't eat but that won't matter 'cause you'll be so sore you can't take a dump. By the way...good morning.
We've got to warn.
Lookin' real good, Freedom.
Freedom, Independence. You're looking good. Prepare to start docking procedures at the MIR.
How we doin', Freedom, over?
You're on your own, Willie. You've got to raise your velocity 17 thousand miles an hour or you won't catch the target, over.
We'll pick 'em up again in sixteen minutes, Danny.
They're hittin' the big G's right about...now.
Freedom, come in, over. Independence, come in, over.
We'll take you in, guys.
We got the top scientific minds in the world working on this. Try "whacking" the thing.
Nothing. Not until we know what happened.
I am secure. Go ahead, General.
When?
Tell the president it's called "budget cuts." We don't have enough telescopes to track the skies.
I don't know. We'll figure it out.
Fly a team up to New York. Contact every Space Watch facility in the
Did we find who made the phone call last night?
Copies to the Pentagon, Colorado Space Command, and the Washington

Okay guys, one of the worst days in N.A..S.A history just got worse. Ten million to one. A rogue comet came from deep space and collided with an asteroid. Some kids actually got a picture of the collision event and told no one. The stuff that hit this morning was the collision's forward- thrown matter, mere pebbles from what's about to come. Walter?
The size of Texas.
How many of you are as scared as I am?
One giant leap for Mankind. Everyone remember that? This is what we are going to do. We're going to fly to that asteroid with a nuclear device, implant it and get off before it blows. Quincy?
You're all looking at us like we're crazy. We're not.
What I'm going to tell you is a breach of national security and could land me in jail, but in eighteen days there arnt' gonna be any jails, so shuttle. Gentlemen, I'm talking about the X-71.
Time is our enemy. This is like the race to the Moon, guys - what this Agency was founded on.
Quincy's been working on excavating the ice from the Moon - he's gonna reorient his thinking. Right, Quince?
I don't care who he is, what he's doing.
It's the late 20th century, I run the U.S. Space Program, and I'm praying to God the Russians are better at this than we are
So, where's our oil driller?
Mister Stamper.. Dan Golden, I'm Director of --
That was a long time ago. I run this place now. And we've got a serious problem on our hands that Quincy here thinks you might be able to help us out with --
I wonder if we might speak alone?
Okay.
Move it along, Quincy.
Well, Mister Stamper, we need you to drill a hole. It's in a difficult place.
Not...this place. This is really out there. Space, Mister Stamper.
We're manning a mission to that asteroid to plant a nuclear device in it's core. To do that we need to drill an eight hundred foot hole.
All we want is your advice in perfecting our drilling arm, any help you can provide. We'll pay your usual consultancy, of course.
Ten million.
Gentlemen, gentlemen, wait a second. The crux of the matter
Or three
You won't need one. You're not going up.
Harry. Let's figure this out.
The deal was for you, not others.
It's out of the question.
What kind of men are these?
This is getting us nowhere. Can they fly, or not?
We need to drill. Do you know how to drill, colonel? Neither do I. They're going up.
General, it's our job to get them ready to go into space. They're there to do the drilling. And Colonel Sharp, we all have families.
This is like putting the Hell's Angels in space.
Projected impact tracking. I need stats!
Warn who? The whole South Pacific?
Stamper, answer me one question - have you ever let anyone down?

....and the two pieces will slide right past us. You cannot shatter it. Getting hit with 20 smaller asteroids is as bad as one big one. You have to drill, plant the nuke, lift off, and detonate -- all before the asteroid reaches this position. You have eight hours. Remember it. You must detonate by this point or, the two halves will hit us.
These guys are fast. Harry, interior gauge check.
A.J.'s off the team. We need a list of names from you to fill the slot.
We don't want independent thinkers. And we don't need heroes. We need a team.
One shot. Pull him in line or send him home.
In the book of Revalations, the Bible speaks of a final day on Earth, when all mankind shall perish, shall cease to exist. This day is known as Armageddon.
When you meet the Russian, you might want to go easy on the guy.

I work for the President of the United States. But I think it's my duty as a scientist to tell the world what is happening. Three, days ago a manned space mission was sent to intercept an asteroid which has entered the Earth's orbit. This is a difficult mission. In all frankness, it is the most difficult mission anyone has ever flown. A little over fifty years ago we sent our Armed Forces half-way around the world to save the world from an evil empire that threatened mass extinction. The men and women of this nation united, answered the calland preserved our freedom. Once again we face a threat to our way of life. And once again we look to our military to preserve our future. The men and women selected to lead this mission are America's finest and most decorated career officers in the military. Our hopes and prayers are with them. Thank you.
We'll do your best.
They'll be pullin' nine and half G's for eleven minutes, General.
If they're still alive.
Come on, Willie, you can do this
Willie? Come in, over. Willie, can you hear me...?
Freedom. come in.
What's the problem?
How much deeper?
Harry, your fault line's fifty yards off the starboard side.
Yeah, Harry. What's your situation?
You're forty minutes in. You should be down 150 feet. How far are you?
"Don't tell me what you can't do, tell me what you can." Remember that, Stamper? Go faster.
How?
What is going on up there?
After 15 minutes? What do you expect?

A surface detonation isn't going to do it, General. My scientists have already told you that. It must be detonated inside the asteroid. The alternative is that the Earth will be bombarded by smaller matter which will be just as catastrophic.
The asteroid's surface is heating up.
It means they may not be able to work on the surface for much longer. The temperatures will be unbearable.
Say nothing.
Now just get the thing in the hole.
Harry, c'mon, we got thirty minutes.
Is he alright?
The situation: the hole is drilled but the remote detonator is not functional. One of the crew is going to stay behind and
Don't stay for this.
Stamper, you gave me your word. You have five seconds. PRESS THE BUTTON!
Where are they, Flip? Give me some angles, give me some directions, give me speeds...
I just want to tell you I'm proud to know the daughter of the man who just saved the world.
When are we going to let N.A.S.A in on what we've found?
Yeah, but this is their sandbox were playing in.
Hell with them, I'm going on Howard Stern
Call N.A.S.A
I have the number. I got it from "Mega monster."
He's some super-hacker, I went to high school with. Guy's totally wired into every encrypted government installation.
They never proved he shut down the power in those seven states.
I got mission control
Uhh hi, I'm an astronomer in Kentucky, and I was wondering if you guys had seen some strange activity in the southern middle quadrant of the asteroid belt between Antares Major and Epsilom Scorpio
My name? Uhh
Lexington... Massachusetts.
So, that N.A.S.A. guy wasn't kiddin; about bein' arrested and
Yes, absolutely, yes sir.
Him.
I was calling the Houston area code, which is 713. I was calling 712, which is outside Spokane, Washington, where my Aunt Zelda
Our math must've been off! we thought it was gonna pass the Earth!

Hey, zipperheads! Ever watch "L.A. Law?" Right to remain silent, right to an attorney? My brother's a badass lawyer - he's gonna sue your asses to Mars. I was in pre-law for a month - you can't put somebody in jail for makin' a phone call!!!
Yeah, that's why they were so hot for the co-ordinates. Do you think it's an asteroid? Or comet?
If it's over then why aren't you lettin' us out of this goddamn cell?
Don't walk away, I want to talk to my lawyer. You hear me?
He flunked the bar three times.
This definitely doesn't look like a glamorous job.
We don't even know what we have yet. Comet, asteroid - it could be anything up there. And don't be so eager to red flag N.A.S.A. They don't call us when they discover anything.

This is our discovery. We're going to hold a press conference. We're going to be famous. SPACEWATCH'll name this thing after us. Job offers are going to fly in from all the big companies. J.P.L., that think tank up at M.I.T., hell even N.A.S.A. 'll be chasing us.
How?

And say what? "Hi, we're a couple astronomer geeks who found something really bitchin; floatin' in space." You can't just call N.A.S.A.  It's like calling the White House. Besides, you'll never get the number.
He's also an ex-con.
Hang up! Hang up now!
Lexington.. uhh...Massachusettes. Idiot. I told you not to call them.
Him.
It's our discovery. No way.
Something they're not telling the public.
I dunno - but I bet it's a whopper.
Southern Hemisphere?
I'm hungry! When're we gonna eat?
Yeah, Mission Control.
Who is this?
This is a restricted line. How did you get it? Where are you?
Can you tell me the exact co- ordinates..?
The F.B.I.'s on it.
Look it that sucker. They got a nuke up there in sixteen hours?
Yeah. That Russian monkey in 1957.
Engine ignition. Starting diagnostics.
Nine hundred and eighty...Nine ninety...they're into the fault, they're doing it.
The new courses are miss us!
Get me Dan Goldman on the secure phone.
I'm going to brief the President. What's going on here, Dan? Why didn't we have warning?
Is it over?
Dan, we're all here. Tell us what we're up against.
Well, that's really positive, Dan. The President just got off the phone with the Russians. They're just about to launch a new Mars Probe on the biggest rocket in the world.
They're going to pull off the probe and replace it with four Atlas Class IV nuclear warheads. Enough punch in their opinion - not to break it up - but to slow it down enough to miss Earth's orbit.
They're going to move it up.
Sixteen hours from now.
Thank you for bringing up the impossible, Dan.

You've watched the news the last 24 hours? You heard about the meteor shower? What you don't know is that an asteroid is on a collision course with Earth. If it hits us, Earth as we know it will be over.
Of course, completely in order. What is the price?
Mr. Stamper, this mission is to preserve the future of
Done.
I'll call the I.R.S., try to uhm, explain the situation.
You want us to buy that, too?
Rock what? Is that a dog?
With my stars came the power to be blunt.  These drillers are not trained for this, Dan.
If they can't drill this hole, my men are going to take over.
Anyone done that before?
This is an exercise in futility.
Your drillers aren't doing the job, Dan.
Golden, we are preparing for surface detonation.
We have a lot better chance of surviving the "smaller matter."  The drillers have two hours I want you ready on my command.
What does that mean?
Golden, tell your drillers the clock is ticking. I have 6 billion people down here relying on them!
In 18 minutes we will be at Zero Barrier. Your father better be a man of his word.
Well, find a solution!!
STAMPER DETONATE!
Can you go secure?
shuttle.
Well, you need to get it fixed unless you want to die along with that asteroid.
Sharp, I NEED A SOLUTION!
world. We gotta find what part of the sky this is coming from.
office. We gotta compute size, composition, speed, impact point WE SEE the photo -- A HUGE ASTEROID
Okay, who?

Right now, that day conflicts with six billion schedules. For the first time in the history of this planet, s species possesses the technology to prevent it's own extinction. I've been with N.A.S.A. my entire adult life. Eleven years as an astronaut, another fifteen on the ground at Mission Control. Twenty- six years I've had to answer one question -- why? Why more money? Why the race for space? Why do we need to know what is up there? When we come through this, I'll take comfort in the fact that I won't ever have to answer those questions again. You are our warriors up there. You are our last hope. God be with you.
Independence, come in. Come in, Freedom.
I'll call J.P.L. and get the Hubble telescope on it.
Dan, our currant shuttle fleet is too old and too slow.
It's done?
Boss, we're good at space travel, but you're talkin' about drilling a hole.
It'll never fly. Never.
Twenty seconds till we lose radio contact, Director.
No cabin pressure! Systems-wide failure!
They overshot their landing 26 miles. There's a different fault line, but it's deeper.
Two hundred feet.
Look at these thermals. This is BEFORE sunlight hits the drill site.  She's really heating up
They just lost the rig. The hole blew out.
Dan, the surface is heating up!
She's gettin' hotter! Gotta mean gas - methane, helium, probably water vapor.
It's a mess up there...!
They got Freedom goin'!
Director? It's Mr. Stamper. He wants to talk to his daughter.
The thrusters are down! 32 seconds.

In it's simplest terms? The end of Mankind. One asteroid, one mile wide or bigger, impacts the Earth with the equivalent force of all the nuclear weapons in the world, times a thousand. Half our population will die within 24 hours from tidal waves and heat pulses. The other half won't be so lucky. In the end, it will be men eating the flesh of other men. It's not the end of the world, General, the world -Earth - will still be here. But there will be no life - maybe cockroaches and some resilient strands of bacteria.
With the worst guidance system in the world. Their Mars Probe in '96 was found by a pygmy tribe in Africa.
Their launch date is set for next month.
To when?

What are they gonna do, glue, spit, and scotch tape it together? Even if they get a nuke out to the asteroid, a surface nuclear detonation is not going to work.  The only way is to split the thing in half and hope the two pieces slide past us.

Mr President, finding this speck in the sky is a very hard thing to do unless you have the exact co- ordinates. There are only twelve telescopes powerful enough to see it right now. You've got a full moon goin' for four days - makes it all but impossible to see.. Once these things draw closer to Earth, you'll never keep a lid on this. No way.
How's she look?
Negative, A.J. Don't exceed ix thousand. Not on this run.
Negative, A.J.
A.J., shut the Armadillo down now.
Firmly.
If we're gonna pull this off, we have to have a little talk about time...and temperature. Zero Barrier's in two hours.
Harry, your suits are good upto 150 degrees Celsius
We didn't anticipate you being on the asteroid so long.  The clock is ticking...
Three hundred and fifty degrees.
Go ahead, Harry.

Look, set a fire cracker off in your open palm, you get a third degree burn. Close your fist, It'll do some serious damage. If we can get a nuke deep in one of the asteroid's fault lines, she'll split in two, like a diamond.
Has been for three months.
Right. And the first thing I'm gonna do is talk to the guy I ripped off. His name is Harry S. Stamper. He's the best oil driller in the world.
He's here.
I'm a big fan, Mr. Stamper.
Nineteen eighty five. The first well drilled over 50 thousand feet. They said it couldn't be done. You did it. Incredible.
Right, sorry. Mister Stamper, you're the world's foremost expert in deep drilling. You hold specialized patents in high speed bits, drilling fluids, downhole motors.  Can I call you Harry?
The "Armadillo" - our fourth generation rover. It carries a six- cell solar engine with 824 horses. This was a joint venture with the Germans. It's designed by Porsche.
This baby works without one.
It works through a series of complexly designed differential gears.
"Drilling Power Transfer Without Conventional Hydraulics," by Harry S. Stamper. You registered it with the U.S. Patent Office last year.
We just borrowed it, Mister Stamper.
Twenty-our million.
We're working on that.
Pressurised titanium alloy cab. Airlocked life support. The chassis's by General Motors. Heavy duty suspension and six wheel drive.
Turbo-jet engine fuelled by Kerosene and liquid oxygen.
A jet engine can't do that.
That's so simple it's brilliant.

The new generation EMU - Extravehicular Mobility Unit - provides oxygen for seven hours, a pressurised enclosure, and temperate control. The gloves and helmet slide on and lock with a twist, like this. The cap is worn underneath. It contains a mike and headphones for two-way communication.  We'll be able to see you from a small video cam mounted inside the helmet. The Undergarment has 300 feet of plastic tubing circulating cooling water. Owen...
Where' it headed? How big?
We'll run your liquid oxygen from the shuttle through a tube into the intake manifold. No problem.
What did our always-at-lunch-Swedish geologist say?
What's his mood?
I'm on top of it Harry, you have a second?
I'll hurry. I've worked for you for a long time.
And you've been real good to me
No. The reason I am here, today, standing here, talking to you. I'm obviously talking to you...but it's, you know, not, uhh...it's not an oil- related matter exactly
You know there comes a time in a man's life when... No, that's a clich√©... Can I start again? I, uhh, fell...I've fallen...
In love, I mean. Fallen in love. It's the damnedest thing, but this person you...know...really well.
We gotta clear the Derrick!
Harry, we've hit pressure. We gotta bleed it off. e go any deeper, we'll blow the rig.
The bit's five thousand feet down! Full speed'll rip the pipe apart!
I'm goin' down. Reattach it. Gimme a wrench and a band coupling.

You know how I told you there were two obstacles? I didn't do the first,'cause he's tough...but I did the second...! I got it at uhm..Tiffany's. I can't give it to you until I talk to him, but try it on.
Good plan, Harry.
I don't think they shit people at N.A.S.A., Harry --
No torque adjustment, no pressure release valve
Wouldn't miss it, Harry.
Chick, Max! Mack truck tranny!
I figured out how to bring up the slag. Direct the jet turbine's exhaust down the drill pipe. It'll blow the stuff right up the hole.
Let's see what this baby can do.
We can do better. I'm increasing the RPM's to seven thousand. We can get more torque.
Relax. I built this thing. She's got more in her. Increasing the RPM's.
We can push it, further. Let's see what she can do.
I pushed it, I screwed up.
I don't know why I didn't just listen to them.
I love you, Grace.
I'm trying to work with the team.
What do you want? You want me to quit?
I don't have to prove anything to anybody, Harry.
I'll follow it.
Excuse me. You're really insanely gorgeous and I was jost sort of wondering if you --
I love you, Grace.
Yeah?
Lev, the pressure's climbing.
My name is A.J.
Goddamn it!
Freedom, come in, over. Freedom, come in, over Freedom...? It's you and me.
Get up, we got work to do.
Lev, we're getting off this rock, if I have to drag your ass the whole way. Now get up!
C'MON LEV, PUT YOUR WEIGHT INTO IT!
So move it.
Over the hill.
EARTHQUAKE!

Listen, Mr. Negative. Everyone thinks we're dead.  We're not. So, suck it up. Because if we don't drill that hole, six billion people are going to die. And I'm not lettin' Harry Stamper get all the freaking credit for saving the world. We're gona do this, then we're going home.
Hep me get these rocks over there.
Stick a cork in it, Lev. I'm tryin' to think.
Because I'm askin'. And turn your suit's thrusters off. Trust me, okay?
Hey, Lev, we're gonna see what this Porche engine can do
HOLD ON, LEV, I GOT HER WORKIN'!!
You wouldn't happen to need a diamond tipper, would you?
One hour.
Harry, we can't stop.
Drill right through the pressure to pay dirt.
Sometimes crazy works.
Full throttle!
Something I've been meaning to talk to you about. When this is all over and we're back home, I'd like to marry your daughter
THIS SUCKS
I ain't gonna draw against you Harry.
Well, I guess I won. Now I'm the guy who gets to save the Earth.
We said we'd join these after we drilled the hole. It just ain't gonna be on Earth.
About Grace, Harry. I know it ain't gonna happen now, but would you say...?
Mean "could have...?"
I'm not going home Harry.
Goddamn it, HARRY
LET ME GO
HARRY!!
Don't worry. He'll come through.
Harry doesn't fail.
What?
Harry PEOPLE embrace
What would Harry do?
He's up there, Grace. And he'll never die. Will you marry me? I gotcha a new rock
You askin' the old man?
The uhh
She's kickin'!
Pressure's north of seven thousand!
The drill hole's flooding!
Get back, she's gonna blow!
We're living LARGE!
Charlie Bronson could kick Steve McQueen's ass and have enough left over to duke it out with Burt Reynolds in his "Smokey and the Bandit" period.
Burt was trouble in that flick.

All time? Well, let me think. "Dirty Dozen," the first "Death Wish." No, no!  That movie where he hunted the buffalo. I don't remember the name but he hunted a buffalo and he said like three words during the whole picture. That's my selection.
He'da whooped his ass and then his father's. We'll settle this right now. Rockhound? You heard the debate. You're the Supreme Court.  What's the final verdict?
There ain't no oil in this place. What the hell are we doing here?
Harry, this is some "Star Wars" shit. This ain't for us.
If Harry-the-iron-ass is going, I'm going with him.
An Ena-WHAT?
And you want to stick it where?
Bodacious and Succulent and Sinful.
No. I got to take care of something.
Hey, Denise.
Hi.
I got a feeling you're going to be pretty big yourself.
'Bye, Tommy.

What I did before was wrong. Every day of my life I regret it. I can see you've got a good thing going, Denise, I'm not trying to mess that up. But this thing's come my way and I got the chance to do something really right.
It's no scam. You might just be proud of me.
I can't tell you now. But if it comes out good, I'll be back. Then maybe you'd consider telling Tommy I'm not a...salesman. It's good to see you. You look really beautiful.
I gotta tell you...I'm scared.
Thirteen months, seven days. What the hell has he been doing all by himself?
I didn't see him.
My kid. You.
Harry, what are you thinking?
Wildcatters are superstitious, Colonel. Harry does this every time we break ground.
The first ten better be the worst ten.
Almost 60 feet and startin' to kick ass!
You sure?
I don't think she can take it.
The last time we ran her at full throttle we ripped her up!
The clutch is dead.
I say we drill. They say we have until Zero Barrier.
Clear the rig!!!
Back to work!
Mutha...it's getting warm.
We just put it in.
She's gonna blow!
Max
Yeah.
Harry
I've been with you fourteen years. I've never said this to you, never thought I would. It's over.
Now you can die with us.
It worked! She's goin' through her like a hot knife through butter!
Eight hundred and twenty feet, Harry.
Downhole pressure's goin' through the roof!
Thousand and three, Harry. With a half hour to spare.
Don't look at me.
This thing definitely doesn't like us.
What's that mean?
I can't watch this.
That means we might die too
I'm dyin' for a Budweiser.
What are you lookin' at?
Almost caught that little bastard.
Watch your language, Gracie.
Stupid birds.
Talking to him quite a bit these days
Good. He's not vulnerable there.
Thieves and cowards, all of 'em. Twist their arms.
Keep twisting. Like a pit bull.
Any kind of flying and oil company executives. Go deal with 'em. I always look better when you're doing the talking.
What'd your mother call me?
Yeah well
I understand we're having problems with "A" rig.
Yeah. One.
Twelve years.
Another company make you an offer, kid?
You're sweating, A.J.
You hurt yourself?
We have results.
Horseshit. What the...? Chick! Bennie! Somebody better tell me why the hell "A" derrick is not turning!
Hey there, what can I do for you?
'Course it is. I love you guys. You like dolphins and whales, I like 'em too. Hey, I know you. You too. Didn't you have shorter hair?
How'd you get out here? Canoe? Rowboat? Oh, that boat down there with a thousand horsepower diesel!
The same way you did when you blow- dried your hair this morning.
Can't wait! I'm a businessman! Those goons over there gave me 57 mil. to find oil and they ain't leavin' till I do! 'cause they have no lives!
Sorry. Time is money. BENNIE!
Bennie! Third gear!
Chick, rig up another pipe. NOW, NOT TOMORROW.
Thanks for that opinion. Chick, full speed!
You learn all this in college? I been doing this thirty years, kid.
There's your oil, gentlemen. Now get the hell off my rig.
To Hole Number Seventy-Six!
Say it now, say it quick, or get off my rig, Major. I've got a business to run here.
Who's doin' the summoning?
I know who you are. I watched T.V. once. Apollo 8, right? First manned lunar orbit.
I kinda caught that. What's the problem, gentlemen?
These two are my right and left arms. Grace Stamper and Albert Jack Frost. Stupid name, so we call him A.J.. They run my company.  You talk to me, you talk to them.
Great, home movies.
Stick with Stamper.
I've drilled in them all.
As in...outer?
A.J., is this guy shitting me?
An eight hundred foot hole. On a moving asteroid. In space.
Show me your rig.
Where's the Kelly?
How does it work?
This is my Patent.
You stole it.
What'd this cost?
Boy, I'm in the wrong line of work. So, that's where my taxes go.  For thievin' incompetent, government employed rip-off artists?
What happens if you hit gas? You have three seconds. Drill faster, run like hell, or pray. Time's up. You're dead., The rig just blew.
Hang on. I betcha everyone in this room has a PH.D.

I left school after tenth grade. I earned my PH.D every day offshore drilling holes. You can't get it in a book. Drilling holes is about instinct - about smellin' it. Drillin' holes is an art. You want the crux of the matter? You stole my patent, and you don't have a goddamn idea how to use it. As for this piece o' crap, don't insult me. I'll rebuild it - the right way - and drill the hole for you.
Just give me a space suit.
You don't have a choice. I think all you PH.D's know that.
First of all, you're going to buy my patent.
Fifty million dollars.
You're right, too low. I'm still pissed. Seventy million.
Give that money to my Greenpeace buddies. Told you...complicated.
I have this great log cabin in Montana. It's kind of a nature...getaway...thing.
No. I fly fish there. But the fly fishin's sucked ever since they put in that goddamn hydro-electric dam. I want it gone by the time I get back.
I'm only as good as the men I work with. The ones in those home movies of yours.
My chief tool pusher. You game A.J.?
And my roughnecks, Roustabouts, and Rockhound?
No. Just a meek, geek geophysicist.
It's a job, like any other. Just a different location.
I'd rather die up there fighting this thing than sit here waiting for it.
Charles, but if you call him that, he'll kill you.
With all due respect, Doctor, I don't know too army guys who are social when someone is trying to jam a tube up their butt.
A lot of people take sedatives.
I don't tell my men how to live their lives. They're with me to do a job and they do it well.
That Armadillo car. Get it in here.
How were you going to power your drill arm?
I need to be able to start and stop. I need different speeds, and I need reverse.
It can if it's hooked up to a clutch. A.J., get me a Mack truck transmission.
